intro: Prionosciadium durangense, commonly known as the Durango scorpionworts, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has finely divided leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
